source.author: David M. Bates,Malvastrum A. Gray subsect. Pedunculosa A. Gray in A. Gray et al., Syn. Fl. N. Amer. 1(1,2): 308. 1897

taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek eremia , desert, and alkea , mallow, alluding to habitat]

bio:treatment.description: Herbs, annual, sometimes gynodioecious. Stems prostrate to erect, sparsely to densely hairy. Leaves: stipules caducous, subulate; blade reniform-round, unlobed or palmately 3-, 5-, [7-]cleft, base truncate to cordate, margins usually toothed, sometimes entire. Inflorescences axillary,
bio:treatment.discussion: Species 3 (3 in the flora): sw United States, nw Mexico.
